messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the Spring Boot framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. To initiate this process, I'll provide you with the path to a file, your task is to determine whether it is possible for this file to contain definitions of REST API endpoints, rather than just project configuration, feature implementation, database operations, unit tests, or functional tests. You need to follow the structured output, including an indication of whether this file contains API entries and the reasoning behind your judgment.

contains_api_entries.description: Whether it is possible for this file to contain definitions of REST API endpoints.
contains_api_entries.title: Contains Api Entries

message.content: {"contains_api_entries":false,"reason":"The path and name indicate a Spring Data repository (CodePasteRepository) under a repository package. Such files typically declare data-access interfaces (extend JpaRepository/CrudRepository) and contain query methods, not controller methods or @RestController/@RequestMapping endpoints. While Spring Data REST can expose repository interfaces as HTTP resources using annotations like @RepositoryRestResource, that is an exception; the repository still represents data access rather than typical hand-written REST endpoint implementations. Therefore it is unlikely this file contains explicit REST API endpoint definitions (but you can confirm by checking for @RepositoryRestResource or similar annotations)."}
